reviews.review_text: Super quick read. If you want a tiny taste of mystery then go ahead and read this short story. Otherwise, go for the novel with Hercule in it.
I give this rating  to nearly  half  of her novels.Short story's are fun reading  when you are busy with other things.
Great book and love the classic cover art.
I actually thought I downloaded the whole story but only got the short story.  I enjoyed it anyway!
Entertaining but she always pulls something unexpected out of the hat; a bit unbelievable at times. Still it was entertaining.
Good classic Christie mystery. Poirot is razor sharp!

The story is classic Poirot and the plot intriguing. Although I don't envy the reader, several of his voices were very nasal and hard to listen to. He also tends to taper off into softer speech from time to time. Since I listen in order to ease sleep, it's annoying to have to raise the volume or repeat a passage I couldn't hear.
Thought I knew who did-was given some miss leads - but I was correct, Yay! for me.
Great quality, good sized lettering and of course, a great story. Great book. Solid feel.

summary:
Book 17/43 in the Hercule Poirot Series

Linnet Doyle is young, beautiful, and rich. She's the girl who has everything--including the man her best friend loves. Linnet and her new husband take a cruise on the Nile, where they meet the brilliant detective Hercule Poirot. It should be an idyllic trip, yet Poirot has a vague, uneasy feeling that something is dangerously amiss.
